passages.text: Latin America | Education Laureate Education

We are hosting a virtual group meeting with Laureate Education CEO Eilif SercK- Hanssen on Thursday, 25 September, 8am BST | 3pm HKT | 4.00pm Tokyo | 5pm Sydney. Management has reduced complexity to focus on Mexico and Peru, doubled EBITDA margin, and deleveraged the company. Laureate has been consistently returning capital to shareholders, leveraging its cash- accretive business model. Registration here.

Laureate operates five private universities with 50 campuses in Mexico and Peru. The firm provides exposure to an expanding middle class and related recognition of the social and economic benefits that can be derived from graduating from higher education institutions, and demand for qualified individuals from the business services, healthcare, and tech industries in LaAtm. This demand also exists in the context of an under- resourced and limited public education sector across the region.

Strong execution. Management has reduced complexity, doubled EBITDA margin, and deleveraged. It has been consistently returning capital to shareholders (1/3 of mcap L3Y), with growing cash flow generation. The company is to return to new openings in 2025 with the Value brand in Mexico, following a 'capex holiday' since 2019, due to the increased penetration of its hybrid model. New openings will add to the current high- single- digit organic growth and should not materially affect its superior cash generation as margins continue to expand.

A market- oriented curriculum. Laureate programmes focus on applied, professional- oriented content for growing career fields and on academic disciplines that offer strong employment opportunities and high earnings potential for students, particularly in science, technology, engineering, and business disciplines, with stronger demand growth, which account for more than \(70\%\) of total post- secondary enrollments.

Brand recognition. Laureate's total enrollment growth has outperformed the private market in both Mexico and Peru, primarily by increasing coverage and penetration, leveraging its strong brand equity, new programs and digital offerings. Laureate institutions and programmes have earned the highest accreditation available, providing it with a strong competitive advantage in local markets. The premium university in Mexico, UVM, ranks second best in Mexico. UPC is the premium brand in Peru, the #9 consumer brand in the country.

Revised FY guidance. Laureate expects total enrollments to be in the range of 491k to 495k students, reflecting growth of \(4 - 5\%\) versus 2024, with revenues expected to be in the range of \(1,615m to\) 1,615m, up \(3\% - 4\%\) in US\$ and \(6\% - 7\%\) in constant currency and \(7\% - 8\%\) growth, and adj. EBITDA of \(48m to\) 496m, up \(9\% - 10\%\) in US\$ and \(11\% - 13\%\) in constant currency.

Structural margin expansion in Mexico, operational leverage in Peru. Laureate expanded margins by \(>40\%\) since 2022 to \(600bps\) through dedicated productivity initiatives and campus footprint optimizations, as well as operating leverage from a LDD growth rate. We expect margins to expand by \(RATINGBUYPRICE$27.48^PRICE TARGET | % TO PT$28.00 | +2%52W HIGH-LOW$27.63 - $14.45FLOAT (%) | ADV MM (USD)83.6% | 25.78MARKET CAP$4.2BTICKERLAUR

Laureate Education Fireside Chat
Date | Thursday, 25 September
Time | 18am BST | 3pm HKT
Market Cap | US\$4.2bn
Management | Eilif SercK- Hanssen (CEO)
Resilient growth, CF accretion and FX
A Proven Compounder | Initiating at Buy
Alex Wright \* | Equity Analyst

Laureate Education operates five private unities with 50 campuses located in Mexico and Peru. The firm provides exposure to an expanding middle class and related recognition of the social and economic benefits that can be derived from graduating from higher education institutions (c50% of intake are 1st generation participants) and demand for qualified individuals from the business services, healthcare, and technology industries in Latin America. This demand also exists in the context of an under-resourced and limited public education sector across the region, and private education accounting for 39% and 76% of the higher- education markets in Mexico and Peru, respectively. Laureate has made significant investments in its digital capabilities, driving strong growth in both online and hybrid learning systems that can free up further capacity at its campuses.

Our Price Target implies 7x 2026 EV/EBITDA (13x PER), 35% below M&A multiples. Key risks include educational regulatory changes, currency movements, new market participants, lower disposable income and poor execution driving margin expansion in Mexico.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of 15% or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus 15% or minus 10% within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus 10% or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10 is 20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently

below \(\) 10\(, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus 20% within a 12 - month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below\) \ \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
- Laureate Education (LAUR: \$27.48, BUY)

**Notes**: Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company,made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
